row.name: PCK.AUTOMIC_ATLASSIAN_JIRA.PUB.ACTION.GET_ISSUE
row.description: Get Issue from Jira by ID or Key

row.Docu:
= Action name = PCK.AUTOMIC_ALTASSIAN_JIRA.PUB.ACTION.GET_ISSUE
= General description = This action is used to fetch details of an issue from JIRA. User can provide either the Issue Id or Key to look for an issue. The Fields param gives a comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. The action will not fail if input provided in Fields param are invalid. The input to Fields param and expected output is as:
*all : Include all fields *navigable : Include just navigable fields -comment : Include everything except comments (the default is *all for get-issue) summary,comment : Include just the summary and comments
The Issue Details would be printed in Job Report.
= Failure Conditions = (none)
= Inputs = * Jira URL : Specify address to the Jira server. Eg. https://www.myjiracom:8081 * Username : Specify username which will be used for Jira. * Password : Specify password for given username. * Issue ID or Key : Specify Issue ID or Key to retrieve details. E.g. 10001 or POC-7. If the issue cannot be found via an exact match, JIRA will also look for the issue in a case-insensitive way, or by looking to see if the issue was moved. The issue key contained in the response will indicate the current value of issue's key. * Fields : Specify fields to retrieve. Eg. summary,description. By default all fields are retrieved. * Overwrite Agent : Overwrites the default agent * Overwrite Login : Overwrites the default login
= Behavior = (none)
= Return Value = The action will publish following AE variables: * UC4RB_JIRA_ISSUE_DETAILS = The variable containing issue details in json format.
= Outputs = * Return code is 0 in case of success. * Return code is 1 in case of failure.
= Rollback = (none)
= Logging = AE logs will be displayed in the AE report. Java logs will be created at \temp\jira.log under agent installation directory.
= Example = (none)
